conclusion: Analyze the areas under the v-t graphs to determine distances traveled by cars.
Car A has a constant velocity of 40 m/s from t = 0 to t = 30 seconds. Car B accelerates linearly from t = 0 to t = 20 seconds and then maintains a constant velocity until t = 30 seconds.
Calculate distance traveled by Car A from t = 0 to t = 10 seconds using constant velocity.
Distance traveled by Car A from t = 0 to t = 10 seconds is 400 m.
Calculate distance traveled by Car B from t = 0 to t = 10 seconds using acceleration.
Acceleration of Car B is 4 m/sÂ².
Distance traveled by Car B from t = 0 to t = 10 seconds is 200 m.
Compare distances: Car A traveled 400 m and Car B traveled 200 m by t = 10 seconds.
Car A is ahead of Car B by 200 m at t = 10 seconds.
